long live & luck

In Western folklore, the stork is often associated with the birth of children. In Chinese culture, it is regarded as a sign of long life and loyalty. In the mythology of some Slavic peoples, the stork is connected with spring and renewal. In Egyptian mythology, the stork was venerated as a sacred animal symbolizing protection and luck.
